definitions.definition: the length of time that a person has lived or a thing has existed.
examples: he died from a heart attack at the age of 51
synonyms: length of life; Morestage of life
age group "he is 35 years of age"

definitions.definition: a particular stage in someone's life.
the latter part of life or existence; old age.
examples: with age this gland can become sluggish
synonyms: maturity; Moreone's advancing/advanced/declining years; literaryeld; archaiccaducity "her hearing had deteriorated with age"

definitions.definition: a division of time that is a subdivision of an epoch, corresponding to a stage in chronostratigraphy.
a lifetime taken as a measure of time; a generation.
examples: Nestor is said to have lived three ages when he was ninety years old
I haven't seen her for ages
synonyms: forever "you haven't been in touch with me for ages"

definitions.definition: grow old or older, especially visibly and obviously so.
cause to grow, feel, or appear older.
examples: he even tried aging the painting with a spoonful of coffee

definitions.definition: (especially with reference to an alcoholic drink) mature or allow to mature.
examples: the wine ages in open vats or casks
synonyms: come of age "Leila has aged a lot since the last time I saw her"

examples: we didn't have a clue how to age these animals
